plugins.name: Move Objects Frame
plugins.description:
Move Objects to Frame - オブジェクトをフレームに移動 -


このプラグインを使えば、選択したオブジェクトを指定したフレーム内に素早く移動 できます。

また、フレームに入っていないオブジェクトを検出 して、整理しやすくします。


主な機能：

✅ 選択したオブジェクトを 元の位置を維持したまま フレーム内に移動

✅ フレーム外にあるオブジェクトを検出し、通知でリストアップ

✅ 英語と日本語の両方に対応

✅ シンプルで直感的なUI


📌 使い方：

1️⃣ 1つのフレーム と フレーム内に入れたいオブジェクト を選択します。

2️⃣ 「移動する」ボタンをクリック すると、オブジェクトが位置を変えずにフレーム内へ移動します。

3️⃣ 「フレーム外を確認 🔍」をクリック すると、フレームに入っていないオブジェクトを検出し、リストで表示 します。


Move Objects to Frame を使って、作業効率をアップし、デザインを整理整頓しましょう！🎯

-----------------------------------------------

This plugin allows you to quickly move selected objects into a chosen frame while keeping their original positions.

It also detects objects that are outside any frames and helps you organize your Figma workspace more efficiently.


Features:

✅ Move multiple objects into a selected frame while preserving their positions

✅ Check if objects are outside any frames and get notified

✅ Supports both English and Japanese

✅ Simple and intuitive UI


📌 How to use:

1️⃣ Select one frame and one or more objects that you want to place inside.

2️⃣ Click the “Move it!” button, and the objects will be placed inside the frame without changing their positions.

3️⃣ To check for objects that are not inside any frames, click “Check Unframed 🔍” and get a list of unframed objects.


Boost your workflow efficiency and keep your designs well-organized with Move Objects to Frame! 🎯
plugins.tagline: Move objects into a frame while keeping their positions. Detect and list objects outside any frames.

plugins.name: Type Rhythm
plugins.description:
A simple plugin for efficiently adjusting typography in Figma. You can increase or decrease font size in 8px increments, and adjust line height in 10% increments. It also allows you to convert Auto line height to 150%. Using tools like Keyboard Maestro to set up shortcuts can enhance your workflow.


Figmaでの文字調整を効率的に行うためのシンプルなプラグインです。フォントサイズを8px単位で増減でき、行間を10%単位で調整可能です。Keyboard Maestroなどのツールを使用してショートカットを設定することで、ワークフローをさらに効率化できます。
plugins.tagline: You can increase or decrease font size in 8px increments.

plugins.name: Structura Swagger Annotator
plugins.description:
Description

Structura revolutionizes how you manage API, design, and copy documentation. With an all-in-one platform, gain clarity on workflows, discover the exact APIs and components used, and ensure precise copies across your designs.


How To?

  1. Run this plugin into your figma files
  2. Paste the whole swagger documentation
  3. Select one of the component and map it by filling the correct path and method
  4. To update the swagger just reupload again the whole json swagger


Feature Request?

Feel free to request more features, for this plugin. Next roadmap for this plugin will be:

  1. Code generation for API request
  2. Hands On API Request on Plugin
  3. Copywriter integration(such as integrating with lokalise)
plugins.tagline: Simplify API and Design documentation by annotating component with swagger API docs.

plugins.name: FontFig
plugins.description:
🤔 How it works:


  1. 1. Choose a font. This will be your base font - it can either be a font you want to manipulate or just help you get a good foundation for the different characters
  2. 2. Import the font. Fontfig will generate an artboard for every character and convert every character into an SVG.
  3. 3. Get creative. Manipulate or create totally new characters.
  4. 4. Export your new font (Whoop)


👉 Pointers:


  1. 📄 One Font can be created / edited per page
  2. 💾 Export each font up to 5 times for one price.
  3. 📐 Adjust the width of the artboard to change letter spacing for each character
  4. 💪 Support for more complex fonts coming soon


💬 We need your feedback:


  1. Drop us a comment or message if you see anything you think could be better. We want to continually improve this Plugin so your feedback is super helpful!
plugins.tagline: Create your own fonts in Figma

plugins.name: TapTail
plugins.description:
😌 No explicit sign-ups, logins or permissions are required to use TapTail. Just run the plugin!


Have you ever wanted to know if the Figma proto you shared was opened? To see where people clicked? To get insights how your proto works? Read on 👇


Use this example prototype created by Figma to try: https://www.figma.com/community/file/915647337333327091/figma-for-beginners-2020-petma-the-social-media-app-for-pets


TapTail brings real usability data into Figma with minimal effort. Install the plugin, create a prototype sharing link, share the link with your subjects and start collecting metrics. Once you collected enough data (at least one session), you will be able to generate a report directly in your prototype's Figma document (on a separate page).


💬 Feedback and questions (I read and reply to every e-mail): laci@taptail.com

♥️ Found it useful? A 'Like' would mean the world to me! :)


————————


Tired of bouncing between Figma and external usability test tools? With TapTail, you can see metrics directly in Figma:

  1. Session details: Total time spent, time to first click , count of unique sessions and more.
  2. Click positions: Numbered circles on each frame show exactly where and in what order users tapped.
  3. Interaction density: How many taps landed on each screen, helping you spot hot and cold zones.
  4. Labels: Add a tag when copying links to know which channel drove each test.


Your original designs stay untouched: all results are exported on a separate page and overlaid on separate layers of your designs' clones.


————————


🛟 How to use

A very detailed, step-by-step guide on how to create a sharing link and a report:


Creating a sharing link:

  1. Run the plugin.
  2. Click the blue 'Create' button.
  3. Provide a 'Name' and your Figma prototype's sharing URL (simply copy like you normally would and paste it here) then click the blue 'Create' button at the bottom. Once done, it will show you a list with the created item on top.
  4. Click the item's link icon to copy the TapTail sharing link: it will ask if you'd like to track the link (this is optional but recommended: use only numbers and lowercase, english alphabet letters without spaces).
  5. Click the blue 'Copy link [...]' button. Sharing link is now copied on your clipboard.
  6. Share the link with your test subjects. When they open it in their browser, your prototype will appear like the original Figma prototype (as if you would shared from the figma.com link).


Report generation:

  1. Run the plugin in the same Figma document where the shared prototype is located (this is important ❗️).
  2. You can check for new sessions with the 'Refresh' link on the top right corner.
  3. Once you have at least 1 session, you can create a report by pressing the 'Play' button.
  4. A confirmation pop-up will appear first. If you confirm, report generation will start and a loading indicator will appear (normally a report generation takes a few seconds, but could be more depending on your machine's computational capacity and the volume of the collected data).
  5. Report is generated on a new page in the document.


————————


⏳ License & Trial

TapTail is currently in open beta, therefore all features and functions are free for a limited period of time! Feedbacks, questions, bug reports: please and thank you 🤗


————————


🔐 Data handling & privacy

TapTail does NOT need access to your name, e-mail, files, comments, projects, components or styles to work. It only needs a very limited set of data to function:


Your identity

  1. Your Figma user ID is stored, but only in a scrambled form called a hash. A hash is like a one-way fingerprint: can't turn it back into the real ID. Your ID is needed to assign your account the free license.
  2. Other identity related data is only needed if you buy a license, then at least a billing name, billing address and an e-mail address is required.


Your prototype link

Your Figma prototype sharing URL (copied from Figma, provided by you manually) must be stored so your prototype can be served for your users via the TapTail sharing link (which looks like this: https://ux.taptail.com/s/<handle>). Part of the prototype link is a string called the 'file key' (format: https://www.figma.com/proto/<file key>/…) which identifies your Figma document. Since the prototype sharing URL is stored, the file key is also stored (as part of the URL). Read more about the implications here and here.


Prototype emitted events

List of Figma emitted events that are captured (with timestamp + data such as node ID, click and scroll cooridnates, etc. – for more info, click the event name below):

  1. MOUSE_PRESS_OR_RELEASE
  2. PRESENTED_NODE_CHANGED
  3. INITIAL_LOAD
  4. NEW_STATE
  5. REQUEST_CLOSE
  6. LOGIN_SCREEN_SHOWN
  7. PASSWORD_SCREEN_SHOWN


This data is only used to build your in-Figma reports and are never shared with anyone else.

You can learn more about embeds in general here: Embed Figma Files.


————————


🚧 Roadmap & new features

In no particular order, directly from my todo list:

  1. define expiration date+time;
  2. define simple instructions/ welcome screen;
  3. designated success screen (to enable missions);
  4. component variant change handling;
  5. data export in structured form (like JSON, CSV, …);
  6. <your ideas maybe? get in touch!>


————————


🪳 Found a bug? Got feedback? Have an idea for a feature?

E-mail me at laci@taptail.com!

I read and reply to every e-mail :)


————————


🫶 Credits

  1. The prototype used for demo in the video: https://www.figma.com/community/file/915647337333327091/figma-for-beginners-2020-petma-the-social-media-app-for-pets
plugins.tagline: Prototype usability analytics right inside Figma

plugins.name: Varcator - Figma Variable Usage Finder
plugins.description:
Varcator - Figma Variable Usage Finder For Dev Mode


Varcator is a Figma plugin that helps you find where text variables are being used in your design files. It provides an efficient way to scan and track variable usage across your Figma projects.


🔥 Highly Recommend to select one variable at a time. 🔥


Features


  1. Variable Collection Scanning: Scan all text variables in your Figma file
  2. Selective Scanning: Choose which variables to scan for usage
  3. Usage Tracking: Find where each variable is being used
  4. Interactive UI: Click on usages to navigate to the specific layers
  5. Efficient Processing: Optimized scanning with rate limiting to prevent API throttling
  6. User-Friendly Interface: Clean and intuitive design for easy variable management
plugins.tagline: Figma Variable Usage Finder for Dev Mode

Features


  1. Variable Collection Scanning: Scan all text variables in your Figma file
  2. Selective Scanning: Choose which variables to scan for usage
  3. Usage Tracking: Find where each variable is being used
  4. Interactive UI: Click on usages to navigate to the specific layers
  5. Efficient Processing: Optimized scanning with rate limiting to prevent API throttling
  6. User-Friendly Interface: Clean and intuitive design for easy variable management
133934.tagline: Figma Variable Usage Finder for Dev Mode

plugins.name: Button Genie Pro
plugins.description:
Welcome to Button Genie Pro, the Figma plugin that instantly generates a fully featured button component set with every variant, state and Token, so you can focus on design, not tedious setup.


https://geniepro.app/


Quick Start


1. Create a new page in your Figma file where you want to place your button component set.

2. Run the plugin: Search for Button Genie Pro.

3. Follow the two-step UI to create variables and generate buttons.



Create Variables Foundations


On the first screen of the plugin, a single click generates 5 variable collections to lay the foundation of your button system. This makes updating your buttons much more flexible:

00 Primitives

01 Style Tokens

02 Semantic Colors

03 Sizing Tokens

04 Component Tokens

05 Typography



Preview and Generate Button Set


1. Light and Dark Mode: See your Primary, Secondary, and Tertiary buttons side by side in Light and Dark Mode. When you choose your Light or Dark Base Color, Button Genie Pro will automatically define the reverted color. (You can always tweaks colors later in your Figma Variables section).

2. Real-time Contrast Check always make sure your text meets WCAG AA or AAA standards.

3. Customize:

- Button text

- Stroke width for secondary button

- Horizontal/vertical padding, gap, and border radius

- Toggle variants: hover, focus, selected, disabled

- Add icon-only or pill-shaped buttons

4. Create Button Set: Click to generate up to 360 variants (3 types × 5 states × 2 shapes × 3 sizes × 4 content variants), a set of semantic buttons (Success, Warning, Error), and a set of placeholder icons. The base color you choose will be added to your custom color scale (myColor/randomName/50–900) in the Primitives variable collection.



Use Your Button Component


- All generated buttons are grouped into component sets in your document.

- Drag instances onto any frame and override text or icon as needed.

- Variables keep your design tokens flexible: update a token to cascade changes through every button.



Troubleshooting


- If you don't see new components:

  1. Ensure you've correctly generated variables/tokens at the first screen, before generating your button set.
  2. This plugin needs a Figma paid subscription to create Variable Modes. Make sure your have one. If not, the plugin will not work as expected.

- For manual hex input issues, make sure to include a leading `#` and six hex digits.
plugins.tagline: Instantly generates fully featured button component sets with variants & variables (tokens).

plugins.name: Freaking Fake Data
plugins.description:
About plugin:

Freaking Fake Data simplifies your design workflow in Figma, FigJam and Slides by letting you fill mockups with custom, project-specific data instead of random content. Take control of your text layers, create tailored datasets and unify data formats for your design team — perfect for consistent names, phone numbers or other details. Working locally, it boosts productivity and eliminates errors while speeding up mockup creation.


Key Features:

  1. Effortless Mockup Filling: Quickly populate text layers with your data.
  2. Unified Team Data: Import a CSV or JSON file for team consistency.
  3. Bulk Text Magic: Mass-apply text to layers with one click.
  4. Cross-Platform Support: Works in Figma, FigJam and Slides.
  5. Easy Data Import: Upload CSV or JSON files instantly.
  6. Default Data Option: Test with preloaded samples (e.g., names, cities).


How to Use:

  1. Import Data: Create a table in a tool like Google Sheets or Excel, fill it with data, export as CSV or JSON, and upload—or use default data. Import multiple files and switch via tabs.
  2. Select Text Layers: Highlight the text layers to apply data to.
  3. Apply Data: Pick a column (e.g., "First Name") and apply data. Choose order:
  4. Sort: Inserts data in table order.
  5. Random: Inserts data in random order.
  6. Explore Options: Switch tabs, view rows, or use "Set as Default" to save a tab for next launch.


How to Create a Table:

  1. Enter data in columns (e.g., "First Name" in one, "City" in another); the first row becomes button names.
  2. Add separators by leaving a column empty with "---" or "- - -" in the header for a line or use "//Special Offers" or "// Special Offers" for a labeled group divider. (example: telegram)


Perfect for prototypes, presentations or team projects — try it now!
plugins.tagline: Fill Mockups Quickly — use unified data for your design team. Massively paste your text into Figma

plugins.name: PRE: AI Design Review
plugins.description:
PRE helps designers and product teams understand how users will interact with their UI designs — before a single line of code is written.


🔹 Select any frame in Figma and click “Upload Selected Frame” to send it to PRE.

🔹 PRE will automatically generate a heatmap, predict click-through rates, and provide UX suggestions using AI.

🔹 You can modify the generated tags, draw additional clickable elements, or toggle the heatmap overlay on and off using the second button in the top bar.

🔹 Once you're happy with the predictions, you can download the heatmap and click data for further analysis or presentation.


Whether you're working on early wireframes or high-fidelity mocks, PRE helps you make design decisions backed by predictive user analytics — all from right inside Figma.


Powered by PRE
plugins.tagline: Export any Figma frame and instantly generate heatmaps, CTR predictions and UX feedback with PRE.

plugins.name: Fillio - Elevate design with dynamic content
plugins.description:
Fillio - Less Typing, More Designing


Fillio is the simplest way to populate your Figma designs with realistic {{placeholder}} content. Whether you’re working on wireframes, prototypes, invoices, brand books, or daily UI design, Fillio saves you time by instantly filling your artboards with dynamic content.



Key Features:


Quick & Easy Filling:

Fill your designs with placeholders like names, addresses, and all type of contents in a single click.


Customizable Placeholders:

Use simple tags like {{name}} or {{Date}} to create dynamic content that fits your design.


Efficient Workflow:

Skip the tedious task of manually adding content—let Fillio do the heavy lifting.


Perfect for Prototypes & Wireframes:

Make your designs look polished even in early stages, without all the manual effort.



How it Works:


  1. Install Fillio from the Figma Community.
  2. Select the elements or frames where you want to add placeholders.
  3. Define Your Placeholders using simple tags like {{name}} or {{Type}}.
  4. Click “Submit”, and Fillio automatically adds content to your design.



Get Started with Fillio Today!

accepted.name: Mohammed M.Akasha
accepted.description: A User-centered Designer who crafts meaningful products through design.

plugins.tagline: Less Filling.. More designing.

plugins.name: Link Spacing & Radius Variables (Alpha)
plugins.description:
One-click application of variables to selected objects


Important: Variable Requirements

1. Variables must be in an external library (local variables are not supported yet)

2. The library must be connected to your file


Variable Naming Requirements:

For Spacing:

- Format: `space-{number}`

- Examples: `space-4`, `space-8`, `space-16`, `space-24`

- Variable value must match the number in the name

For Radius:

- Format: `radius-{number}`

- Examples: `radius-4`, `radius-8`, `radius-16`

- Variable value must match the number in the name


Collection Requirements:

- Spacing collection must include the word "spacing" in its name

- Radius collection must include the word "radius" or "border-radius" in its name


How to Prepare Your File

1. Connect the variable library:

- Open "Team Library" menu

- Find the required library

- Enable the toggle next to the "Variables" section

2. Ensure objects are prepared:

- For spacing: objects must use Auto Layout

- For radius: objects must support the cornerRadius property


How to Use

1. Select objects you want to apply variables to

2. Launch the plugin

3. Choose the desired collection from the dropdown (marked with 📚 icon)

4. Click "Apply spacing" or "Apply radius"
plugins.tagline: Link spacing and radius variables

plugins.name: Lexi: Localize & Translate your design
plugins.description:
Design once—translate instantly. Lexi automates text translation in your Figma frames while keeping your layout intact. Perfect for multilingual apps, marketing assets, and App/Play Store screenshots.


🚀 Why Lexi?

50+ languages – Translate your designs into multiple languages in seconds.

Batch translation – Select multiple frames & languages at once.

Seamless workflow – Translated frames stay organized with clear naming.



🔧 How It Works

Select your frames – Pick the designs you need to translate.

Choose your languages – Supports all major languages, including English, Spanish, Japanese, Arabic, and more.

Translate with AI – Lexi uses OpenAI’s GPT-3.5 Turbo for high-quality, natural translations.

Get organized output – New frames are created, named with language codes, and maintain the original design structure.


🔒 Best Practices

Font compatibility – If a language isn't displaying correctly, try swapping fonts to Roboto or Inter for best results.


Who is Lexi for?

🌎 Designers working on global products.

📱 Teams creating multi-language UI/UX designs.

📢 Marketers adapting assets for international campaigns.

🏢 Agencies handling multilingual clients.


Credits:

Some of the designs featured in this plugin are from @ramsriperambudr. Thanks for the amazing work! 🙌


Ready to make your designs multilingual? Start localizing with Lexi today! 🚀
plugins.tagline: Translate all text in selected frames—perfect for multilingual apps & App/Play Store assets.

plugins.name: OS converter
plugins.description:
Stop duplicating your work! Convert entire flows or single frames between iOS and Android in seconds — no more tedious manual adjustments.


Why OS Converter?

Designers are often faced with a choice:

  1. Design in one OS and leave conversions to developers
  2. Manually recreate each flow for both platforms


With OS Converter, you get the best of both worlds — fast, accurate, and hassle-free conversion.


How it works:

  1. Set up your components – Use a variant property named "OS" with values "iOS" and "Android"
  2. Run the plugin – When your layouts are ready to convert
  3. Click to swap! – Convert single frames or entire flows in one click
  4. 🎨 See it in action! Check out the sample file below.

plugins.name: Zuuvi Export Service
plugins.description:
Zuuvi Export Service is a Figma plugin designed to integrate Figma with Zuuvi’s Studio platform, making it easier and more efficient for designers who work with both tools. The plugin helps reduce the need to manually recreate designs in Studio after first mocking them up in Figma. While built around Figma’s capabilities, the exported result aims to reflect the original design as closely as possible within the constraints of Studio’s features.


Easily export ad creatives from Figma directly into your Zuuvi workspace - ready for production, personalisation, and cross-channel publishing.

Whether you're designing HTML5 banners, social media ads, retail media formats or in-store screens, this plugin helps creative teams move faster and stay in control.


🔧 What You Can Do with the Zuuvi Plugin:

  1. Export static or layered ad designs directly from Figma to Zuuvi
  2. Optimise for use across display, social, retail media, DOOH, video, and more
  3. Support for production-ready HTML5 ad creatives
  4. Maintain template structure and layer control for streamlined animation workflows


🚀 Why Use Zuuvi for Your Ad Production?

Zuuvi is a Creative Performance Platform that empowers marketers and designers to:


  1. Build high-quality, high-performing HTML5 ads at speed
  2. Personalise and localise creatives across channels and markets
  3. Scale ad production without adding design overhead
  4. Centralise all ad formats - from social media creatives to dynamic banners - in one platform


📚 Documentation & Support

Full plugin guide and step-by-step tutorials: https://help.zuuvi.com/en/articles/10774913-how-to-export-from-figma-to-zuuvi-studio


Questions? Reach out anytime via our live chat or care@zuuvi.com


🧩 Requirements

To use this plugin, an active Zuuvi account is required.

Not a user yet? Learn more and book a demo here.


🔒 Data Security

We value your creative integrity and your data privacy. Zuuvi follows best practices for security, and all plugin exports are processed securely through your Zuuvi account.


Design in Figma. Scale in Zuuvi.

From idea to high-performing ad campaign – Zuuvi makes creative production fast, scalable, and impactful.
plugins.tagline: Convert your Figma designs to omnichannel ad campaigns

plugins.name: 切图尺寸整合 Image Size Integration
plugins.description:
介绍

切图尺寸整合插件让 Figma 用户能够高效地管理和整合图像，适用于框架、组、组件等设计元素。通过该插件，您可以调整图像大小，并应用统一的尺寸以确保设计的一致性。


功能说明

  1. 允许用户选择多个元素（框架、组、组件、文本、实例等）。
  2. 自动计算所选元素的最大宽度和最大高度。
  3. 在预览框内显示每个选定的图像，用户可以选择保持原始尺寸或根据最长边进行缩放。
  4. 开关功能：切换保持图像原始尺寸或根据预览框大小调整图像。
  5. 提供灵活的控制选项，用于调整图像在预览框中的显示方式。


使用方法

  1. 选择您想要预览和调整的元素（框架、组、文本、组件、实例等）。
  2. 点击“生成Base64预览图”按钮以生成图像预览。
  3. 使用开关切换，选择是保持图像原始尺寸还是根据预览框尺寸进行缩放。
  4. 在插件界面直接查看调整后的图像及其对应尺寸。


注意事项

  1. 本插件支持栅格图像和矢量元素。
  2. 图像将显示在固定大小的预览框内，缩放设置会根据您的开关选择进行应用。
  3. 插件操作依赖于 Figma 画布上的选中元素，请确保在使用插件前选中正确的元素。


Introduction

Image Size Integration allows Figma users to efficiently manage and integrate images within frames, groups, and components. With this plugin, you can adjust image sizes and apply uniform dimensions for a consistent design output.


Function Description

  1. Allows users to select multiple elements (Frames, Groups, Components, Text, Instances, etc.) in a Figma design.
  2. Automatically calculates the maximum width and height from the selected elements.
  3. Displays each selected image inside a preview box, either maintaining its original size or resizing it based on the longest side, as determined by the user's settings.
  4. A toggle feature to switch between maintaining the image's original size or scaling it to fit the preview box.
  5. Supports flexible control over how images are displayed within their allocated preview space.


How to Use

  1. Select the elements (Frames, Groups, Text, Components, Instances, etc.) you want to preview and adjust.
  2. Click the "Generate Base64 Preview" button to create image previews.
  3. Use the toggle to switch between keeping the image’s original size or scaling it to fit the preview box.
  4. View the adjusted images and their corresponding dimensions directly within the plugin's interface.


Notes

  1. The plugin supports both raster images and vector elements.
  2. Images will be displayed in a fixed-size preview box, and resizing settings apply based on your toggle choice.
  3. The plugin works with selected elements in Figma's canvas, so ensure you have the right items selected before applying the tool.

accepted.name: KingweiCheung
accepted.description: Everything gets a response, but nothing gets a resolution. 事事有回应，事事不答应。

plugins.tagline: Easily integrate and adjust image sizes for frames.

plugins.name: Quick Variant
plugins.description:
Allows designers to quickly cycle through component variants for selected instances. With simple commands, you can switch to the next or previous variant of a component, streamlining your design workflow.


Key features


  1. Rapidly explore different component states without manual swapping
  2. Efficiently test various design options in context
  3. Seamlessly navigate complex component sets
  4. Boost productivity when working with design systems


Perfect for designers who frequently work with component variants and want to speed up their iteration process.
plugins.tagline: Essential keyboard shortcut to swap variants of components

plugins.name: Filler
plugins.description:
A simple data safe lorem ipsum generator, that let's you be specific about the type and length of content to add.


How to use


Launch the plugin with the full ui, or keep it as a quick action from the command panel, either way goes. Enter the amount of sentences words or paragraphs to insert and hit enter!


From yours truly,

Ryan Nono
